result.execSummary:
The defendant Krystle L Stagman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 38 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: all counts, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
AMENDED 08-02-2017:  DNA surcharge assessed and to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Continue participation in the Drug Court Alumni Group.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim (J. D.) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant has successfully completed Drug Treatment Court.

State moves to amend count 1 from a Felony to 3 Misdemeanors.
Court lifts the Stay and Enters a Guilty Judgment on the 3 Misdemeanors.



Court orders the following:
On All Three Counts:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
38 Days Credit on each count.
Concurrent to all counts.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
On each count - Concurrent to each count.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Continue participation in the Drug Court Alumni Group.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (J.D.) listed in 15CF952 Criminal Complaint.
